TenUI::ITenUIApp

TenUI::ITenUIApp Class Reference

#include <ITenUIApp.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Subclassed by TenUI Applications This interface is the construct of a TenUI application. It declares the basics that the TenUI Application must supply. TenUI uses this interface to
  • setup the display
  • setup the input
  • initialize the application
  • notify the application of:
    • frame rendering is about to occur (preframe)
    • frame rendering is occurring (frame)
  • deinitialize the application when execution has been halted.

Public Member Functions

Member Function Documentation

virtual IGraphics* TenUI::ITenUIApp::initGraphics (  )  [pure virtual]

Applications should initialize their IGraphics object here. TenUI will use IGraphics object for rendering.

Returns:
pointer to IGraphics object

virtual void TenUI::ITenUIApp::initUserInputs (  )  [pure virtual]

Applications should initialize and register UserInput objects to UserInputManager

See also:
UserInputManager

virtual void TenUI::ITenUIApp::init (  )  [pure virtual]

Applications should place any initialization code here. Code that initializes and registers UI Controls and Containers can be placed in this method.

virtual void TenUI::ITenUIApp::update_preframe (  )  [pure virtual]

Callback method called before frame rendering.

virtual void TenUI::ITenUIApp::update_frame (  )  [pure virtual]

Callback method called during frame rendering. This method will be ran in parallel to frame rendering. Processing that doesn't not effect rendering should reside here.
